page.title: 14THE PINFOLD,HAMBLETON.
page.content: The Pinfold is situated near the junction of the A63 and Common Lane.The Pinfold was built before 1554 when most fields had no boundry fences or natural hedges to keep the animals in.So most animals became strays.The Pinder was the name given to the owner of the Pinfold and it was his job to collect all stray animals.The charge for the owner to retrieve his stock was 2d for every score of sheep 4d for a number of pigs and 1d for a horse or beast.The Pinder didn't have to feed the animal unless they were left over before being claimed then an extra charge was made for feeding.If the animal was not claimed in a week the Pinder could sell it.The Pinfold was restored in 1980,and now set into the wall is a beautiful carved plaque made by Mr.A.Steels of the village crest.
